In agreement with prior efforts
36 , we did find significant inter-model differences in the case of RCMs (note the spread of TX95 predictions from different models in Fig. 8a–i) as well as in the case of GCMs (note the spread of TX95 predictions from different models in Fig. 9a–h), mainly in northern SA. The inter-model differences were characterized by computing the standard deviation (STD) of the spread of decadal TX95 estimates (2046–2055) from different models. Figure 8j shows the STD values of RCM-based TX95 estimates shown in Fig. 8a–i, while Fig. 9i shows the STD values of GCM-based TX95 estimates shown in Fig. 9a–h.
